page.description: The PRODUCTINFO.A5W is a public page that displays a single product record, allowing a customer to see a larger product picture and a longer product description.

section.title: Discussion
section.description: The page calling the PRODUCTINFO.A5W page provides a filter expression in the URL that filters the GRD_PRODONE grid component so that it displays only one record. PRODUCTINFO.A5W includes a custom JavaScript file named shopcart.js to show a popup for the shopping cart. The popup window appears when the customer clicks the shopping cart image. PRODUCTINFO.A5W also contains the NAV_MAIN navigation component and GRD_PRODNAV grid component.

section.title: Edits to the Page Source
section.description: When you look at PRODUCTINFO.A5W with the Source tab of the HTML Editor, you will see a large amount of HTML and Xbasic code. The HTML Editor placed almost all of it there automatically, as we used the WYSIWYG tab to place the tables, text, graphics, and components on the page. There are a few interesting exceptions, where we changed the page code through the Source tab. The a5w_include("loggedinvalues.a5w") statement runs the code on the LOGGEDINVALUES.A5W page. This page creates and sets the values of session.protectedpUser.userid, session.protectedpUser.type, and session.protectedpUser.name.

Next, the code defines the welcome message for the current user. If no name was found for the current user, welcome is set to NULL. If a user name was found, the welcome message includes the session.protectedpUser.name.
section.example: if session.protectedpUser.name = "" welcome = "" ' welcome message for current user shown below product navigation list else welcome = "Welcome "+session.protectedpUser.name+"!" end if

section.description: The location = "" statement clears any highlighted entries in the menu.
section.example: with tmpl_NAV_MAIN location = "" componentName = "NAV_MAIN" end with

section.description: The code gets the style from the grid component. It will be needed to format the welcome and header messages.
This code overrides the grid's filter to show only the record where Product_Id matches pid.
section.example: with tmpl_GRD_PRODONE DBF.filter = "alltrim(Product_Id)=\"" + alltrim(pid) + "\"" componentName = "GRD_PRODONE" end with

section.description: The page script then adds the search form. See Creating the Abstracted Search Code. Later the pgstyle variable styles the heading of the page.
